dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.heading: Overview of your video surveillance
dashboard.no_events_description: No recordings were found, make sure your Agent is properly configured.
dashboard.loading_live_view_description: Hold on, we are loading your live view here. If you didn't configure your camera connection, update it on the settings pages.
dashboard.name: Name

recordings.title: Recordings
recordings.heading: All your recordings in a single place

info.kerberos_hub_demo: Have a look at our Hub demo environment, to see Hub in action!
info.configuration_updated_success: Your configuration has been updated successfully.
info.verify_hub_error: Something went wrong while verifying Hub.
info.verify_persistence_error: Something went wrong while verifying the persistence.
info.verify_camera_error: Something went wrong while verifying the camera settings.
info.verify_onvif_error: Something went wrong while verifying the ONVIF settings.

overview.description_advanced_configuration: Detailed configuration options to enable or disable specific parts of the Agent
overview.description_encryption: Enable encryption for all outgoing traffic. MQTT messages and/or recordings will be encrypted using AES-256. A private key is used for signing.
overview.description_encryption_enabled: Enable encryption for all MQTT messages.

camera.description_camera: Camera settings are required to make a connection to your camera of choice.
camera.only_h264: Currently only H264/H265 RTSP streams are supported.
camera.rtsp_h264: A H264/H265 RTSP connection to your camera.
camera.sub_rtsp_h264: A secondary RTSP connection to the low resolution of your camera.
camera.description_onvif: Credentials to communicate with ONVIF capabilities. These are used for PTZ or other capabilities provided by the camera.

recording.description_recording: Specify how you would like to make recordings. Having a continuous 24/7 setup or a motion-based recording.
recording.description_max_duration: The maximum duration of a recording.
recording.description_threshold: The number of pixels changed to record.
recording.description_autoclean: Specify if the Agent can clean up recordings when a specific storage capacity (MB) is reached. This will remove the oldest recordings when the capacity is reached.
recording.autoclean_description_enable: Remove oldest recording when capacity reached.
recording.autoclean_description_max_directory_size: The maximum MBs of recordings stored.
recording.description_fragmentedrecordings: When recordings are fragmented they are suitable for an HLS stream. When turned on, the MP4 container will look a bit different.
recording.fragmentedrecordings_description_enable: Fragmented recordings are required for HLS.

streaming.description_stun_turn: For full-resolution livestreaming we use the concept of WebRTC. One of the key capabilities is the ICE-candidate feature, which allows NAT traversal using the concepts of STUN/TURN.
streaming.force_turn_description: Force TURN usage, even when STUN is available.
streaming.stun_turn_description_forward: Optimizations and enhancements for TURN/STUN communication.
streaming.stun_turn_description_transcode: Convert stream to a lower resolution
streaming.description_mqtt: An MQTT broker is used to communicate from
streaming.description2_mqtt: to the Agent, to achieve for example livestreaming or ONVIF (PTZ) capabilities.
streaming.description_realtimeprocessing: By enabling realtime processing, you will receive realtime video keyframes through the MQTT connection specified above.
streaming.description_realtimeprocessing_enabled: Send realtime video keyframes through MQTT.

conditions.description_timeofinterest: Only make recordings between specific time intervals (based on timezone).
conditions.timeofinterest_description_enabled: If enabled you can specify time windows
conditions.description_externalcondition: Depending on an external web service, recording can be enabled or disabled.
conditions.description_regionofinterest: By defining one or more regions, motion will be tracked only in the regions you have defined.

persistence.description_kerberoshub: Agents can send heartbeats to a central
persistence.description2_kerberoshub: installation. Heartbeats and other relevant information are synced to Hub to show realtime information about your video landscape.
persistence.description_secondary_persistence: Recordings will be sent to secondary persistence if the primary persistence is unavailable or fails. This can be useful for failover purposes.
persistence.description_persistence: Having the ability to store your recordings is the beginning of everything. You can choose between our
persistence.kerberoshub_encryption_description: All traffic from/to Hub will be encrypted using AES-256.
persistence.kerberoshub_description_proxyurl: The Proxy endpoint for uploading your recordings.
persistence.kerberoshub_description_apiurl: The API endpoint for uploading your recordings.
persistence.kerberoshub_description_publickey: The public key granted to your Hub account.
persistence.kerberoshub_description_privatekey: The private key granted to your Hub account.
persistence.kerberoshub_description_site: The site ID the Agents belong to in Hub.
persistence.kerberoshub_description_region: The region we are storing our recordings in.
persistence.kerberoshub_description_bucket: The bucket we are storing our recordings in.
persistence.kerberoshub_description_username: The username of your Hub account.
persistence.kerberosvault_description_provider: The provider to which your recordings will be sent.
persistence.kerberosvault_description_directory: Subdirectory the recordings will be stored in your provider.
persistence.kerberosvault_description_accesskey: The access key of your Vault account.
persistence.kerberosvault_description_secretkey: The secret key of your Vault account.
persistence.kerberosvault_description_maxretries: The maximum number of retries to upload a recording.
persistence.kerberosvault_description_timeout: If a timeout occurs, recordings will be sent directly to the secondary Vault.
persistence.dropbox_description_directory: The subdirectory where the recordings will be stored in your Dropbox account.
persistence.dropbox_description_accesstoken: The access token of your Dropbox account/app.
persistence.remove_after_upload: Once recordings are uploaded to some persistence, you might want to remove them from the local Agent.
persistence.remove_after_upload_description: Remove recordings after they are uploaded successfully.
